context.note: The following procedure will remove from your system. All data stored in the installation directory will be removed, including any customizations or any other data you have stored within that directory. Make a back up of any data you want to keep before uninstalling .

step.cmd: Backup any data you want to keep from the installation folder.

choices.choice: On Windows use the appropriate uninstaller shortcut provided with your OS.
On OS X and Unix manually delete the installation folder and all its contents.

step.cmd: If you want to remove the user preferences:

choices.choice: On Windows Vista/7/8/10, remove the directory: %APPDATA%\Roaming\com.oxygenxml%APPDATA%\Roaming\com.oxygenxml.author%APPDATA%\Roaming\com.oxygenxml.developer%APPDATA%\Roaming\com.syncrosvnClient (usually %APPDATA% has the value: [user-home-dir]\Application Data). Note that this directory is hidden.

On Windows XP, remove the directory: %APPDATA%\com.oxygenxml %APPDATA%\com.oxygenxml.author %APPDATA%\com.oxygenxml.developer%APPDATA%\com.syncrosvnClient (usually %APPDATA% has the value: [user-home-dir]\Application Data).
On Linux, remove the directory: .com.oxygenxml.com.oxygenxml.author.com.oxygenxml.developer.com.syncrosvnClient from the user home directory.

On OS X, remove the directory: Library/Preferences/com.oxygenxmlLibrary/Preferences/com.oxygenxml.authorLibrary/Preferences/com.oxygenxml.developer Library/Preferences/com.syncrosvnClient of the user home folder .
